bug.author: rcurtin
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h4>Issue description</denchmark-h>
The binding, found in , doesn't have a corresponding test in . This leads to errors like those that are fixed in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/2431>#2431</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h4>Your environment</denchmark-h>
version of mlpack: git master operating system: debian compiler: gcc 9 version of dependencies (Boost/Armadillo): shouldn't matter for this issue any other environment information you think is relevant:
<denchmark-h:h4>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Build tests, try to run bin/mlpack_test -t KRANNMainTest, see that it doesn't exist. :) <denchmark-h:h4>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
bin/mlpack_test -t KRANNMainTest should run some integration tests on the mlpack_krann binding. <denchmark-h:h4>Actual behavior</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>$ bin/mlpack_test -t KRANNMainTest Test setup error: no test cases matching filter or all test cases were disabled </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h4>How to fix</denchmark-h>
Basically, we just need to implement tests for the binding. There is a lot of information for how to do that in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/issues/1152>#1152</denchmark-link> .

comments.comment: Is anybody working on this one? I think I understand the issue, would like to give it a try.

So sorry for being so late. I had some homework to submit. I think I have run into a problem, I wrote 11 tests for alpha, tau, dimensions and so on. I built the project, initially there were some errors, but I corrected them, now the test just runs indefinitely. I read some boost documentation but couldn't figure out where the problem was.<denchmark-link:https://github.com/UtR491/mlpack/blob/krann-test/src/mlpack/tests/main_tests/krann_test.cpp>The code</denchmark-link> .

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/UtR491>@UtR491</denchmark-link> no worries, there is no hurry. :) Are you still having the problem? If so, can you pinpoint which test is hanging? You could run with, e.g., .

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/rcurtin>@rcurtin</denchmark-link> That problem is resolved now. Thanks! I made a PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/2442>#2442</denchmark-link> . Should have mentioned the issue in it. My bad. But, I have run into another issue, there is a <denchmark-link:http://ci.mlpack.org/job/pull-requests-mlpack-static-code-analysis/5077/cppcheck/>build error</denchmark-link> for a file I did not even edit!! I have not seen it for a couple of days because I have been busy between college work and fixing some mistakes in other PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mlpack/mlpack/pull/2427>#2427</denchmark-link> .

That's strange, maybe we have to whitelist that error in the static code analysis. Don't worry about it; I saw that error once before for something else and whitelisting was the approach that we took there too. üëç
